intro: Macrocarpaea robin-fosteri, commonly known as the Hawaiian macrocarpaea, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces fruit that contains tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is protected by conservation efforts.
